channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 希拉里-斯万克（Hilary Swank）仍然沿着洛杉矶的街道开车，她和她的母亲曾经在这条街上停车和睡觉。"尽管挑战重重，我还是怀念那些日子，我们一无所有"
item.description: Hilary Swank still drives along the L.A. street where she and her mom used to park and sleep. "Despite the challenges, I feel nostalgia for those days, when we had nothing." on.wsj.com/3wkbEi5 on.wsj.com/3wkbEi5

item.title: Capital One 与 Discover 的交易旨在打造维萨卡和万事达卡更大的竞争对手。以下是消费者和商家需要了解的信息。
item.description: The Capital One-Discover deal aims to create a bigger competitor to Visa and Mastercard. Here’s what consumers and merchants need to know. on.wsj.com/3OQ66Cg on.wsj.com/3OQ66Cg

item.title: 金-卡戴珊：好莱坞》（Kim Kardashian: Hollywood）即将下架，这让这款手机游戏的死忠粉大为恼火，有些人花光了辛苦赚来的虚拟现金，还打算欺骗自己的虚拟丈夫。
item.description: The pending demise of “Kim Kardashian: Hollywood” has die-hard fans of the mobile game in a tizzy, with some spending all their hard-earned virtual cash and planning to cheat on their virtual husbands. on.wsj.com/3T3DmIU on.wsj.com/3T3DmIU

item.title: 泰勒-斯威夫特（Taylor Swift）在拉斯维加斯举办巡回演唱会所带来的经济影响至少在一个方面被超级碗比赛所超越：大型比赛对该地区短租市场的收入影响更大。
item.description: The financial impact of Taylor Swift’s tour in Las Vegas was edged out by the Super Bowl in at least one area: The big game had a bigger revenue impact on the area's short-term rental market. on.wsj.com/3UIpG7m on.wsj.com/3UIpG7m

item.title: 不只是你。家电故障越来越多，维修费用也越来越高。
item.description: It’s not just you. Appliances are breaking down more and are more expensive to fix. on.wsj.com/3UIpAN2

item.title: 在医学从业者称之为流行病的今天，专注于社会联系的企业家在全国各地如雨后春笋般涌现。"我们的孤独感正在让我们生病"。
item.description: Entrepreneurs focused on social connection are popping up around the country amid what medical practitioners are calling an epidemic. “Our sense of loneliness is literally making us sick.” on.wsj.com/3uIBVGw on.wsj.com/3uIBVGw

item.title: 纽约市有 8000 多处人行道棚架，笼罩着纽约市的人行道，这是一个难以解决的问题
item.description: More than 8,000 sidewalk sheds—scaffolding—enshroud New York City’s sidewalks, and it’s a problem with no easy fix on.wsj.com/42JmGtn on.wsj.com/42JmGtn

item.title:
R to @WSJ：在各州就在线赌博合法化展开辩论时，各公司承诺对问题赌徒进行干预，但确保合规的法规却少之又少。
了解更多有关博彩应用程序如何让赌徒上瘾的信息：
item.description:
As states debated legalizing online gambling, companies promised to intervene with problem gamblers, but there are few regulations to ensure compliance.

Read more about how betting apps keep gamblers hooked: on.wsj.com/3SKr1b3 on.wsj.com/48qkeZS

item.title:
R to @WSJ：费舍尔曾多次申请禁止使用赌博应用程序，并在当地教堂参加了她的第一次 12 步戒赌会议。
一位小组成员告诉她不要再感到孤独。她哭了。
item.description:
Fischer applied multiple times to be banned from gambling apps and attended her first 12-step meeting for gamblers at a local church.

One group member told her not to feel lonely anymore. She cried. on.wsj.com/42OvIp0

item.title:
R to @WSJ：随着债务的增加，费舍尔花费了更多的时间和金钱试图摆脱困境。免费赠品给了她继续努力的理由。
美国顶级在线博彩公司 DraftKings 邀请她在一间提供食物和饮料的套房里观看一场 NFL 比赛。
item.description:
As her debts grew, Fischer spent more time and money trying to dig her way out. The freebies gave her a reason to keep trying.

DraftKings, one of America's top online-betting companies, invited her to watch an NFL game from a suite with food and drinks. on.wsj.com/42M3o6x

item.title: R to @WSJ：赌场一直都在招揽大额赌客，但网络博彩却强化了这一策略。这些公司每天 24 小时跟踪赌客的投注习惯，提供积分和其他奖励，以说服最有价值的赌客--顾名思义，也就是输得最惨的赌客--重返赌场。
item.description: Casinos have always wooed high-rollers, but online-betting has intensified tactics. Companies track betting habits 24 hours a day, offering credits and other incentives to persuade their most-valued gamblers—by definition, the biggest losers—to return. on.wsj.com/3ORjINT

item.title:
R to @WSJ：去年夏天，费舍尔连赢六天，赢了 50 万美元。这笔钱可以弥补每次糟糕的下注。她要求开始从一个赌博应用程序中提取这笔意外之财，但却不断改变主意。
一天之内，她几乎输光了所有的钱。
item.description:
Last summer, Fischer hit a six-day hot streak and won $500,000. It would make up for every bad bet. She made requests to start withdrawing the windfall from a gambling app—but kept changing her mind.

Within a day, she lost nearly all of it. on.wsj.com/49DMdGD

item.title: R to @WSJ：这位 41 岁的女士有两个年幼的儿子，她有时一次下注数万美元，结果一输再输。她至少向一家赌博公司抱怨自己有问题，但却无法停止。与此同时，红利和贵宾优惠却源源不断。
item.description: The 41-year-old with two young sons at times bet tens of thousands of dollars a spin, losing again and again. She complained to at least one gambling company that she had a problem but couldn’t stop. Meanwhile, the bonus credits and VIP offers kept coming. on.wsj.com/3T6i0dN

item.title:
卡维塔-菲舍尔成为一名精神科医生，是为了了解人类大脑的奥秘。
在将近一年的时间里，她成了自己的一个谜，因为赌博公司让她不断下注，直到她输掉了 40 多万美元。
item.description:
Kavita Fischer became a psychiatrist to understand the mysteries of the human brain.

For nearly a year, she became a mystery to herself as gambling companies kept her betting until she lost over $400,000. on.wsj.com/3wwinFz on.wsj.com/48oY5Lx

item.title: 保守派电台主持人戴夫-拉姆齐（Dave Ramsey）为年轻人提供了大量理财建议，但年轻人并不领情
item.description: Young adults are seeing a lot of financial-advice TikToks from conservative radio host Dave Ramsey, and they’re not having it on.wsj.com/49I7UFG on.wsj.com/49I7UFG

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：印度的印度教民族主义者必须实现快速的经济增长以维持他们的支持，但经济现代化将不可避免地涉及大规模的、令人不安的社会和文化变革，@wrmead 写道。
item.description: From @WSJopinion: India’s Hindu nationalists must produce rapid economic growth to maintain their support, but economic modernization will inevitably involve massive and unsettling social and cultural change, writes @wrmead on.wsj.com/48iEe0E

item.title: 为何备受诟病的航空公司收费又开始悄然上涨？
item.description: Why a much-hated airline fee is starting to creep up again on.wsj.com/3UNJupL on.wsj.com/3UNJupL

item.title:
RT by @WSJ：雷切尔-戈德堡-波林（Rachel Goldberg-Polin）23 岁的儿子赫什（Hersh）在 10 月 7 日哈马斯对以色列的袭击中受重伤并被劫持为人质。自那以后，她再也没有他的消息。
我上周去耶路撒冷见了雷切尔。
item.description:
Rachel Goldberg-Polin’s 23-year-old son, Hersh, was severely injured and taken hostage in the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israel. She has not heard from him since.

I went to Jerusalem last week to meet Rachel.

wsj.com/world/middle-east/ho…

item.title: "人们认为只要是合法的，就是安全的。这完全是谬论"。受污染的大麻给使用者带来了新的健康风险。
item.description: “People consider that if it’s legal, it’s safe. It’s a complete fallacy.” Contaminated marijuana is raising new health risks for users. on.wsj.com/3uEHQMI on.wsj.com/3uEHQMI

item.title: 在过去的一年里，沙特阿拉伯一直是华而不实的支出计划的传送带--而这一切都变得相当昂贵
item.description:
Saudi Arabia has been a conveyor belt of flashy spending plans over the past year—and it’s all getting rather expensive on.wsj.com/42TXgJB

on.wsj.com/42TXgJB

item.title: 回顾：在《终有一天，我要为自己工作：本杰明-沃特豪斯（Benjamin Waterhouse）在《有一天我会为自己工作：征服美国的梦想与妄想》一书中告诫人们，不要夸大小企业给创业者带来的乐趣及其给经济带来的好处。
item.description: Review: In “One Day I’ll Work for Myself: The Dream and Delusion That Conquered America,” Benjamin Waterhouse cautions against exaggerating the joys of small business for the entrepreneur and its benefits to the economy on.wsj.com/3V5pFuz on.wsj.com/3V5pFuz

item.title: 🎧 听：在今天的 "期刊播客 "中，@Brabbott42 报道了年轻人患癌率的上升，以及我们对这一趋势的了解和不了解。
item.description: 🎧 Listen: In today's episode of The Journal podcast, @Brabbott42 reports on the rise of cancer among young people, and what we know—and don't know—about the trend on.wsj.com/3UIhQus

item.title: 面部识别、步态分析和其他生物识别扫描技术可以取代办公室徽章和定期密码重置。但这对你的隐私意味着什么呢？
item.description: Facial recognition, gait analysis and other biometric scanning could do away with office badges and regular password resets. But what will it mean for your privacy? on.wsj.com/3SJdWyZ on.wsj.com/3SJdWyZ

item.title: 与饮食有关的慢性疾病正在增加。有时，相互矛盾的建议也无济于事--还记得低脂热吗？一项耗资 1.89 亿美元的新研究旨在改变这种状况。
item.description: Chronic diseases linked to our diets are on the rise. Sometimes-conflicting advice hasn’t helped—remember the low-fat craze?—and has resulted in little improvement in our health. A new $189 million study aims to change that. on.wsj.com/49pCnZo on.wsj.com/49pCnZo

item.title: 乐评与之前的作品相比，MGMT 的第五张专辑《Loss of Life》充满了忧郁气息，呈现出一种更民谣、更朴素的美感。
item.description: Review: MGMT’s melancholy fifth album, "Loss of Life," features a folkier, more stripped-down aesthetic than that of its previous efforts on.wsj.com/3I726JX on.wsj.com/3I726JX

item.title: Planet Fitness 前首席执行官 Chris Rondeau 在公司裁员后辞去了该连锁健身房董事会的职务。
item.description: Former Planet Fitness Chief Executive Chris Rondeau has resigned from the gym-chain’s board after the company laid off a portion of its corporate workforce on.wsj.com/3T2K6GO on.wsj.com/3T2K6GO

item.title: 一位家居装饰大亨为其位于盖蒂中心旁、面积约 15,000 平方英尺的洛杉矶住宅开价 6,800 万美元。
item.description: A home-furnishings mogul is asking $68 million for his roughly 15,000-square-foot Los Angeles home next to the Getty Center on.wsj.com/3wqtm3D on.wsj.com/3wqtm3D

item.title: 亚马逊正式加入蓝筹股行列：周一开始交易时，亚马逊将取代沃尔格林博姿联盟（Walgreens Boots Alliance），被纳入著名的道琼斯工业平均指数（Dow Jones Industrial Average）。
item.description: Amazon is officially joining the blue chips: It will be included in the venerable Dow Jones Industrial Average at the start of trading Monday, replacing Walgreens Boots Alliance on.wsj.com/3SPcBXr on.wsj.com/3SPcBXr

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：今天的主流观点认为，乔-拜登和唐纳德-特朗普在乌克兰问题上是对立的。但 @wjmcgurn 写道：在未能阐明战略论点的问题上，两人是一丘之貉。
item.description: From @WSJopinion: The dominant narrative today holds that Joe Biden and Donald Trump are opposites on Ukraine. But when it comes to the failure to spell out a strategic argument, the two are one, writes @wjmcgurn. on.wsj.com/49lwSe6

item.title: 查尔斯-杜希格（Charles Duhigg）写道，成为一个能与任何人沟通的 "超级沟通者 "是一门科学，我们每个人都可以从中吸取经验教训。
item.description: There’s a science to becoming a “supercommunicator” who can connect with anyone, writes Charles Duhigg, and all of us can learn its lessons. on.wsj.com/3wpFge0 on.wsj.com/3wpFge0
